summary.location: 5* St. Raphael Resort and Marina, Limassol, Cyprus

submission_details.track: Reproducibility Studies and Negative Results (RENE) Track
submission_details.page_limit: 12 pages for new studies, 5 pages for appendices

summary.event: The 33rd IEEE International Conference on Software Analysis, Evolution and Reengineering (SANER 2026)
summary.description: SANER 2026 invites high-quality submissions of papers covering original and unpublished research results within the fields of software analysis, evolution, and reengineering.

publication_details.note: Authors of selected research papers will be invited to submit revised versions for a special issue in Springer’s EMSE Journal.

topics_of_interest: AI for Software Engineering and Software Engineering for AI
Generative AI and LLM applied to analysis, evolution and reengineering of software
Software Analysis, Parsing, and Fact Extraction
Software Maintenance and Evolution, Evolution Analysis
Software Architecture Recovery and Reverse Architecting
Mining Software Repositories and Software Analytics
Software Release Engineering, Continuous Integration and Delivery
Software Tools for Software Evolution and Maintenance
Human factors and legal aspects in the context of Software Analysis, Evolution and Reengineering
Empirical studies on all the above topics
Education related to all the above topics
